title: Benmarl 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: This unctuously concentrated Cabernet Franc offers loads of succulent black-cherry and berry flavors nuanced with bramble and green herb. Prominent notes of spice, vanilla and toast integrate well on the palate. While full bodied and a bit plush, a bite of firm tannin structures the finish.

title: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Rosé of Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: Subtle whiffs of raspberry and watermelon entice on the nose of this dry Merlot rosé. Elegantly concentrated and pleasantly puckering, it's a thirst-quenching quaffer to enjoy well into the fall season.

title: Campogiovanni 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This bright, easy-drinking red opens with classic Sangiovese aromas of fragrant blue flower, wild berry, baking spice and a whiff of earth. The savory, enjoyable palate doles out juicy red cherry, cinnamon and a hint of pipe tobacco alongside vibrant acidity and silky tannins.

title: Campolargo 2014 Branco Barrica Verdelho (Bairrada)
description: This wood-aged wine is definitely toasty, full of spice and wood flavors. The perfumed fruit is still hidden by the wealth of wood and needs more time. Ripe yellow fruits waiting in the background have good potential. Wait until 2017.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Some wood aging has given this wine attractive toast and vanilla flavors. They go well with the pineapple and apricot fruit, cut through with lemon zest. The wine is still developing and will be better from 2017.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Branco

title: Stevens 2013 StevensXY Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from the Dineen, Sheridan and Meek vineyards. It brings aromas of thyme and other fresh herbs along with orange peel, tobacco and spice. The brooding dark fruit flavors bring a sense of freshness, with the tannins providing some grip. It needs some time in the cellar to show its best.

title: SuLei 2014 Beet Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (65%) and Syrah, this wine brings aromas of baking spices, wet copper penny and herb that are followed by tart, plump cranberry and raspberry flavors that provide appeal.

title: Nemeion Estate 2005 Hgemon Grand Réserve Agiorgitiko (Nemea)
description: This is a straightforward but tasty red with a nose of vanilla, herbs and blackberry. Flavors of tomato, herbs and blackberry are integrated and finish fresh. A good everyday pour with an exotic flair.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Quinta de Fafide Red (Douro)
description: An elegant wine that is balanced between blackberry fruits and tight acidity. It is structured with a blend of wood aging and crisp fruit. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Reserva Quartz White (Beira Interior)
description: From vines in the mountains of eastern Portugal, this is a delicate, floral and crisp wine. Refreshing with shots of acidity, orange zest and lemon, it is bright and tight.

title: Il Poggione 2013 Leopoldo Franceschi  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Aromas of espresso, underbrush, French oak, plum, and exotic spice lead the nose. The bright, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, roasted coffee bean, star anise, tobacco and a savory note of cured meat alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2015 Les Natures Riesling (Alsace)
description: Some earthy tones cling to the ripe pear and peach of this wine. A hint of bitterness on the palate is leavened by a bright, pure streak of lemon on a dry and slender body.

title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Produced from a small parcel of old vines, this is a crisp and fresh wine. With red-cherry fruit and acidity, it is a bright wine, up-front with its fruitiness and lively aftertaste.

title: Lasseter 2015 Enjoué Estate Grown Rosé (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended from 70% Syrah, 18% Mourvèdre and 12% Grenache, this concentrated refresher offers light, crisp waves of vanilla-cherry, grapefruit and orange. It will remain restrained in the glass if not revelatory in ripe fruit.

title: Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Cahuil Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Roasted plum and savory meat aromas are more earthy than bright. Creamy and a touch sticky in feel, this deals flavors that follow the nose, including baked plum, pepper and savory notes. On the finish, it's oak and peppery spice in the lead.

title: MCV 2015 TMZ White (Paso Robles)
description: Quite light in the glass, this wine leans a tad sweet on the nose, with exuberant apple blossoms, jasmine and banana-chip aromas. There is a chalky tension and pithy grip to the palate, where apple, pear and white-peach flavors trend toward ripe guava.

title: Fuligni 2014 Ginestreto  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Delicately fragrant, this opens with aromas of underbrush, blue flower, game, red berry and menthol. The aromas carry over to the ethereal palate along with a note of savory grilled herb and white pepper. Supple tannins and vibrant acidity provide support while a saline note closes the finish.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2015  Picpoul de Pinet
description: There's an attractive richness to the ripe stone and tropical fruit core of this wine, laced with hints of citrus peel and saline that shine on the finish. The medium-weight body is balanced by ample acidity, helping to preserve the wine's fresh and lively feel. Drink now.

title: Gordon Estate 2013 Block 3 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Subdued herb, red fruit and spice aromas are followed by quite reserved cherry and berry flavors. It displays a lot of restraint.

title: Domaine Fritz Schmitt 2015 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Floral overtones join ripe pear notes on the nose. The palate comes in with even more generous, juicy pear fruit, the rounded flavors boosted by a little residual sweetness that makes the wine finish off dry.

title: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc Rosé (Wahluke Slope)
description: This pale peach, lightly bricked wine brings aromas of strawberry and melon rind. It drinks dry with a broad feel and fruit flavors that linger.

title: Gros Ventre 2013 Cerise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: An aroma like fresh-cut wood leads to straightforward cherry and apple-skin flavors and a tight, dry texture with very firm tannins. Solidly built this wine needs a high-calorie dish to equalize it or more time in the bottle. It will be best after 2018.

title: HammerSky 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Juicy and velvety aromas of dark strawberry and purple fruits show on the nose of this bottling from a winery that also boasts an inn. The palate offers a decent if slightly chunky mineral-driven structure, with slate and crushed-rock flavors hiding the simple blackberry flavors behind a light veil.

title: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2014 Im Berg Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Gentle notes of creaminess and ripe pears signal a soft, creamy wine with lots of texture and body. The rounded body carries some weight and is edged with a bitter marzipan note. All this is countered by fresh acidity, more creamy, nutty notes and a vanilla finish.

title: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2014 Muhlforst Riesling (Alsace)
description: Earth and apple notes unite to make this juicy, fresh and sprightly Riesling. The style is dry, helped by a slight phenolic grip and that characteristic, lime-lemon acidity that brightens everything.

title: OS Winery 2013 R3 Red (Yakima Valley)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (40%), Merlot (30%) and Cabernet Franc, this wine offers aromas of green savory herbs and green olives leaning hard into the savory. The flavors are perfumed and lively, with the tannins showing some grit.

title: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)
description: A little bit of the old world mixed in with the new, this elegant North Fork Cab balances lush black-cherry and plum flavors against savory accents of bramble, barnyard and dried porcini. Bright acidity lifts the midpalate and leads a long, delicately tannic finish.

title: Fall Line 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Boushey, Artz and Red Willow vineyards. Aromas of tire rubber, herb and red and black fruit lead to a soft palate backed by fine grained tannins.

title: Mirabelle NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: A virtual fruit salad with bubbles, this wine gushes cherry, apple and banana aromas. It has equally ripe flavors and a broad, almost soft texture punctuated by lively effervescence.
